name: PreviewOnCallSchedule
description:
Generate a preview of an on-call schedule without saving it.

This tool previews an on-call schedule, allowing users to see time periods when team members are on-call without making any permanent changes. Useful for planning and adjustments before finalizing the schedule. Requires appropriate OAuth permissions.

parameters.name: versioning_header
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the API to use. Typically set as a string like 'application/vnd.pagerduty+json;version=2'.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: The content type of the request, should be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: start_date_range
parameters.description: The start date and time for the schedule preview. Use ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-10-01T10:00:00Z').

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date of the range for the on-call schedule preview. Format as ISO 8601 string.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: schedule_data
parameters.description: JSON object representing the schedule to be previewed.

parameters.name: include_overflow_entries
parameters.description: Set to true to allow schedule entries to overflow beyond the date range bounds. Defaults to false. True includes entries beyond specified dates.

value_schema.description:
Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter `overflow=true` is passed. This parameter defaults to false.
For instance, if your schedule is a rotation that changes daily at midnight UTC, and your date range is from `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` to `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`:


- If you don't pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`.
- If you do pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T00:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-02T00:00:00Z`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: overflow
parameters.description:
Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter `overflow=true` is passed. This parameter defaults to false.
For instance, if your schedule is a rotation that changes daily at midnight UTC, and your date range is from `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` to `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`:


- If you don't pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`.
- If you do pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T00:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-02T00:00:00Z`.

value_schema.description:
Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter `overflow=true` is passed. This parameter defaults to false.
For instance, if your schedule is a rotation that changes daily at midnight UTC, and your date range is from `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` to `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`:


- If you don't pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`.
- If you do pass the `overflow=true` parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of `2011-06-01T00:00:00Z` and end of `2011-06-02T00:00:00Z`.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
